availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Nixon (Covington, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Mary A. Clemon Nixon. Father of Eudora Nixon, Edward Nixon, George Nixon, Emma Nixon, Edith Nixon, and Willard Nixon. Attorney in Covington in 1860. Attorney in Covington in 1861. Served in the 41st Regiment Kentucky Infantry as a private from September 4,1862 to October 4, 1862. Tax collector in Covington in 1863. Tax collector in Covington in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 3, p. 616.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 861.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 2, p. 362B
Bureau of the Census. Official Register of the United States, Containing a List of the Officers and Employees in the Civil, Military, and Naval Service. [Sept. 30, 1863] p. 39. (accessed through ancestry.com on June 24, 2019)
Find A Grave, "John S. Nixon (1824-1875)," Memorial #92200762, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92200762 (accessed June 24, 2019)
